liveview_h.introAudio_Txt: Live View is the default page that opens when accessing the Axis product. Live video is displayed directly in the browser window.To set an external video source go to Setup > Live View Config > Layout.
liveview_h.intro_Txt: Live View is the default page that opens when accessing the product. Live video is displayed directly in the browser window.
liveview_h.default_video1_Txt2: To temporarily display the view from any individual video stream, simply select the stream from the drop-down Source list. The default view setting can be changed permanently in the Live View Config > Layout settings.
liveview_h.external_Txt: The Live View page can also display live video from external video sources, i.e. from other Axis video devices on the network. See Source below.
liveview_h.see_ptz_Txt: See also the help on Pan Tilt Zoom controls.
liveview_h.viewsize_Txt1: To view the image at a different size, click the appropriate button, to switch to half-size (x0.5), full-size (x1), x2 or x4.
liveview_h.viewsize_Txt2: Note 1: This function is not supported by QuickTime or the Java applet.
liveview_h.viewsize_Txt3: Note 2: The image is only resized in the browser window - the actual image resolution does not change. This also means that there is no difference in bandwidth utilization when changing the view size.
liveview_h.resize1_megapix_Txt: Click this button to scale the image to 800 pixels in width.
liveview_h.resize1_megapix_Txt-1: Click this button to scale the image to fit the browser window.
liveview_h.resize2_megapix_Txt: Click this button to return the image to full scale.
liveview_h.resize2_megapix_Note_Txt: Note that these buttons will only be visible for Motion JPEG and for resolutions with width higher than 800 pixels.
liveview_h.resize2_megapix_Note_Txt-1: Note that these buttons will only be visible for Motion JPEG, H.264 and for resolutions with width higher than 800 pixels.
liveview_h.liveview_help_lightfinder_Txt: These buttons can be used to manually change between Wide Dynamic Range Mode and Lightfinder Mode.
liveview_h.liveview_help_wdrOnOff_Txt: These buttons can be used to manually enable or disable Wide Dynamic Range.
liveview_h.format_switch_haiti_Txt1: To quickly switch between pre-defined or created stream profiles, select the profile from the drop-down list.
liveview_h.format_switch_haiti_Txt2: The stream profile only changes on the Live View page, the default stream profile set through Setup > Live View Config > Layout page is not affected.
liveview_h.format_switch_Txt1: To quickly switch between the video formats Motion JPEG and MPEG-4, select the format from the drop-down list.
liveview_h.format_switch_Txt2: The video format only changes on the Live View page - the default video format, as set on the Setup > Live View Config > Layout page is not affected.
liveview_h.palette_Txt1: Select a palette from the drop-down list to color the image and improve visibility of fine details. Colors in the image indicate temperature differences.
liveview_h.palette_Txt2: The palette only changes on the Live View page - the default palette, as set on the Setup > Video & Audio > Video Stream page is not affected. The Palette drop-down list is enabled under Setup > Live View Config > Layout.
liveview_h.io_buttons_Txt: The status and control of I/O ports in the product can be viewed by enabling the display of buttons for this purpose. To enable input/output ports go to Ports & Devices > I/O Ports.
liveview_h.radio_buttons_Txt: Input ports - the radio buttons show if the port is active or inactive as defined under Ports & Devices > I/O Ports.
liveview_h.output_buttons_Txt1: Output ports - the buttons control the devices connected to the output ports directly from the Live View page.
liveview_h.output_onoff_Txt1: The first two buttons are displayed if the output is configured for simple Active/Inactive operation.
liveview_h.output_pulse_Txt1: This third button is displayed if the output is configured for Pulse operation. This means that when the button is clicked, the output is activated for a certain period only, after which it goes inactive again. The length of the pulse is configured when setting up the event type.
liveview_h.output_pulse_Txt2: Note: Input/Output buttons are only displayed if they are enabled under Setup > Live View Config > Layout.
liveview_h.output_buttons_Txt2: The I/O output(s) on the product can be controlled manually, by enabling the display of buttons for this purpose.
liveview_h.output_onoff_Txt2: The first two buttons are displayed if the output is configured for simple Active/Inactive operation.
liveview_h.output_pulse_Txt3: This third button is displayed if the output is configured for Pulse operation. This means that when the button is clicked, the output is activated for a certain period only, after which it goes inactive again. The length of the pulse is configured when setting up the event type.
liveview_h.output_pulse_Txt4: Note that these buttons are only displayed if this is enabled in Setup > Live View Config > Layout and the output ports are enabled under Ports & Devices > I/O Ports.
liveview_h.iV_Txt: These two buttons are diplayed whenever an Intelligent Video (IV) module is running.
liveview_h.iV__button1_Txt: This button opens the configuration page for the module.
liveview_h.iV_button2_Txt: This button displays the current status and/or results for the module.
liveview_h.seq_button_Txt: Click this button to view video in Sequence Mode. This special mode displays the view from 2 or more
liveview_h.seq_ptz_Txt: PTZ preset positions (see below) in sequence, where the preset position is automatically switched, randomly or in order, and at a configurable interval.
liveview_h.seq_sources_Txt: video sources in sequence, where the source is automatically switched, randomly or in order, and at a configurable interval.
liveview_h.seq_stop_Txt: Click this button to stop the Sequence mode.
liveview_h.seq_button_display_dome_Txt: Note that these buttons will not be visible until a sequence mode has been configured from Setup > Dome Configuration > Sequence Mode.
liveview_h.seq_button_ptz_Txt: Note that these buttons will not be visible until a sequence mode has been configured fom Setup > PTZ Configuration > Sequence Mode.
liveview_h.seq_button_display_Txt: Note that these buttons will not be visible until a sequence mode has been configured from Setup > Live View Config > Sequence Mode.
liveview_h.audio_clip_Txt: To play an audio clip choose a clip from the drop-down list and click the play button. Drop-down list must be enabled under Live View Config > Layout > Action buttons.
liveview_h.src_virtual1_Txt: Source - Select a View Area or a Preset Position from the drop-down list. View Areas are defined areas of the view that are treated as different video sources. Each View Area can have several Preset Positions. View Areas are configured under Video
liveview_h.src_virtual3_Txt: > View Areas and Preset Positions under PTZ > Preset Positions.
liveview_h.presetsPTZ_Txt1: The product can be configured with multiple Preset Positions, i.e. pre-defined camera views. These positions can quickly be adopted by selecting the required preset from the PTZ Preset drop-down list.
liveview_h.presetsPTZ_Txt2: Presets are configured from Setup > PTZ > Preset Positions.
liveview_h.presets2_Txt1: The product can be configured with multiple Preset Positions, i.e. pre-defined camera views. These positions can quickly be adopted by selecting the required preset from the Source drop-down list.
liveview_h.presets2_Txt2: Presets are configured from Setup > PTZ Configuration > Preset Positions.
liveview_h.src_ext_2_Txt1: be set up to display images from other Axis devices on the network. These are known as External Video Sources. Select an alternative video source to view by selecting it from the same drop-down Source list.
liveview_h.liveview_streamsource_txt: The Live View page can be used in different view modes. Each view mode is a defined area of the view that is treated as a different video source. The settings for the listed view modes can be changed through Setup > Video > Video Stream. Note that, it is not possible to add or remove a view mode. Select a view mode from the drop down list.
liveview_h.liveview_overviewmode_txt: This is an overview of the entire area under surveillance. To switch to another view, select the view mode from the Source drop-down list.
liveview_h.liveview_panoramamode_txt: This is a 180 degree view whereby the camera presents a wide field of view. Operator can use Panorama to get a better view of areas of interest.
liveview_h.liveview_doublepanoramamode_txt: These are two 180 degree panoramic views facing in opposite direction. Note that, Double Panorama is available if the camera is set as mounted on a ceiling or as Desktop.
liveview_h.liveview_quadviewmode_txt: This is four views presented on a single Live View page whereby each view is focusing on a different direction. Quad View may be useful when the operator needs to see all camera views at once. Note that, Quad View is available if the camera is set as mounted on a ceiling or as Desktop.
liveview_h.liveview_viewareamode_txt: This is a standard camera view whereby the Live View page shows the camera view and an Overview map. The Pan/Tilt/Zoom bar can be used to steer the camera to cover the area of interest. If preset positions are defined, the presets are listed under the view area for which they are defined. Select a preset position to steer the camera view to that position. Click Home to steer the camera to home preset position and click Overview map to hide or unhide the Overview map.
liveview_h.liveview_overviewsnapshotmode_txt: The Overview Map can be used to navigate to any position in the View Area mode. Click inside the Overview map and the camera will move to that position. The current position is indicated by the green circle. Note that the Overview map is available in the View Area mode only.
liveview_h.liveview_overview_note_txt: Note: Overview Map will be displayed in the View Areas mode only if AMC (ActiveX) is selected for Windows Internet Explorer or when Server push is selected for other browsers.
liveview_h.liveview_overviewsnapshotmode_note_txt: Note: Double Panorama and Quad View options are only available if the camera is set as mounted on a ceiling.
liveview_h.src_ext_2_Txt2: External video sources are configured from Setup > Live View Config > External Video.
liveview_h.trigger_button_Txt: When selected as the Trigger type in the Action Rule setup, these buttons can be used to manually start and stop the Action Rule.
liveview_h.trigger_button_note_Txt: Note: These buttons are active only if they are enabled in Setup > Live View Config > Layout and in Events > Action Rules > Add... > Trigger > Input Signal > Manual Trigger.
liveview_h.liveview_help_Fan_button_Txt: This button can be used to manually start the product's fan. Enable this button from Setup > Live View Config > Action Buttons.
liveview_h.liveview_help_Heater_button_Txt: This button can be used to manually start the product's heater. Enable this button from Setup > Live View Config > Action Buttons.
liveview_h.liveview_help_IRillumination_button_Txt: The buttons can be used to manually activate or de-activate IR illumination. Move the slider to increase or decrease the intensity of the IR LEDs. Enable this button from Setup > Live View Config > Action Buttons.
liveview_h.snapshot_Txt1: Clicking this button opens a new window showing a snapshot image from the video stream. Right-click on the image to save it as a JPEG.
liveview_h.snapshot_Txt1-1: Click this button to open a new window showing a snapshot image from the video stream. Right-click on the image to save it as a JPEG.
liveview_h.snapshot_Txt2: This button is mainly intended for use with browsers other than Microsoft Internet Explorer, or when otherwise not using ActiveX to view the video stream. The ActiveX viewing component for Microsoft Internet Explorer (AXIS Media Control) provides its own snapshot button (see below).
liveview_h.snapshot_Txt3: Note that this button is not displayed by default - it must first be enabled in Setup > Live View Config > Layout.
liveview_h.setup_link_1Txt: This link displays the setup menu. An operator will be able to access most of the tools not included in System Options, which are only available to administrators.
liveview_h.setup_link_2Txt: The setup link can also be hidden, by clicking the Configure button for Custom Settings, in Setup > Live View Config > Layout > Use Custom Settings, and then de-selecting Show setup link.
liveview_h.setup_link_3Txt1: The page that opens when clicking on this link can be set to an alternative configuration page, called Plain Config. This is a simple web page that provides direct access to all of the parameters in the product. This should only be used by advanced users.
liveview_h.setup_link_3Txt2: To use the Plain Config page as the default configuration page, open the page from Setup > System Options > Advanced > Plain Config and then check the box provided at the top of the page.
liveview_h.toolbar_Txt1: The Viewer Toolbar is displayed immediately below the video stream and provides various buttons and controls for performing common tasks. There are several different viewers available, the one to use is selected and enabled from Setup > Live View Config > Layout.
liveview_h.toolbar_Txt2: The buttons shown below are for the AMC toolbar, which is configured from the AXIS Media Control Applet. This can be accessed from the Windows Control Panel, or it can be started directly by right-clicking in the image and clicking Settings in the menu that appears.
liveview_h.play_stop_Txt: The Play/Stop button toggles start/stop of the live video stream.
liveview_h.snapshot_AMC_Txt1: Clicking the Snapshot button saves a JPEG snapshot of the image currently being displayed in the video stream.
liveview_h.snapshot_AMC_Txt1-1: Click the Snapshot button to save a JPEG snapshot of the image currently displayed in the video stream.
liveview_h.snapshot_AMC_Txt2: Note that the Snapshot function's behaviour and the target directory for saving snapshots can be configured from the AXIS Media Control applet, which is opened from the Windows Control Panel, or by right-clicking in the image and selecting Settings.
liveview_h.mpeg_rec_Txt1: Click the Start recording button to make a recording. Click again to stop the recording.
liveview_h.mpeg_rec_Txt2: Recording settings can be modified from the AXIS Media Control applet, which is opened from the Windows Control Panel, or by right-clicking in the image and selecting Settings.
liveview_h.fullscreen_Txt: Clicking the View Full Screen button causes the video image to fill the entire screen area. No other windows will be visible. Press the 'Esc' button on the computer keyboard to cancel full screen view.
liveview_h.joystick_button_Txt: These buttons change the click-in-image mode, to and from Emulated joystick mode and Center mode. See the PTZ Controls below.
liveview_h.joystick_button_Txt-1: These buttons change the click in image mode, to and from Emulated joystick mode and Center mode. See the PTZ Controls below.
liveview_h.audio_buttons_Txt: The audio functions are controlled by the following buttons:
liveview_h.audio_talk_listen_Txt1: These two buttons toggle Talk and Listen respectively. Both buttons are displayed when using the half-duplex audio mode, as configured under Setup > Audio. The Talk button is also displayed in Simplex -
liveview_h.audio_talk_listen_Txt2: speaker only mode, where it can be used as a secrecy button.
liveview_h.audio_mute_Txt: The Speaker and Microphone buttons mute/enable the speaker and microphone respectively. The speaker and microphone slider controls adjust the audio levels.
liveview_h.audio_hidden_Txt: This button is shown if there is insufficient space to display all of the audio controls. Click to reveal the hidden settings.
liveview_h.audio_oneway__buttons_Txt: The speaker buttons mute/enable the speaker and the speaker slider adjusts the audio levels.
liveview_h.ptz_Txt1: The PTZ control bars perform their respective functions in two different ways.
liveview_h.ptz_Txt2: Clicking a position directly on the bar moves the camera all the way to the new position in one movement, so it is possible to e.g. move all the way from the extreme left to the extreme right simply by clicking once on the bar.
liveview_h.ptz_Txt3: Clicking on the arrows at the ends of the bar causes instead a stepped, incremental change. The 3 movement controls available are;
liveview_h.ptz_Txt4: the Pan bar - used to move the view to the right and left
liveview_h.ptz_Txt5: the Tilt bar - moves the view up and down
liveview_h.ptz_Txt6: the Zoom bar - zooms the view in and out.
liveview_h.ptz_Txt7: Note: Pan and tilt must be enabled under PTZ > Controls.
liveview_h.ptz_Txt7-1: Note: Pan and tilt must be enabled under PTZ > Advanced > Controls.
liveview_h.ptz_nopantilt_Txt: Note that pan and tilt operations are not possible when the product is fully zoomed out.
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt1: It is also possible to control the camera view by using Click-in-image movement, which has two different types of navigation; Center and Emulated joystick.
liveview_h.opticLiveZoom_NoteTxt: Note: The Center and Emulated joystick modes are not available when Optical Live Zoom is selected as a PTZ mode.
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt2: Center mode means that when clicking in the image, the camera view will center on the position that was clicked. The location to move to has a definite position, e.g. 'position x,y.'
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt2-1: Center mode means that when clicking in the image, the camera view will center on the position that was clicked. The location to move to has a definite position, example 'position x,y.'
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt3: Note: the click-in-image fuction will not be available when PTZ control queue is enabled and Java applet has been selected as default viewer under Live View Layout.
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt3-1: Note: the click in image fuction will not be available when PTZ control queue is enabled and Java applet has been selected as default viewer under Live View Layout.
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt4: Emulated joystick mode moves the camera view in the direction of the mouse pointer, relative to the center of the image, that is, the camera view e.g. 'moves left' or 'moves down.' To use this method, point to a location in the image and then press and hold the left mouse button. The camera stops moving when the button is released.
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt4-1: Emulated joystick mode moves the camera view in the direction of the mouse pointer, relative to the center of the image, that is, the camera view 'moves left' or 'moves down.' To use this method, point to a location in the image and then press and hold the left mouse button. The camera stops moving when the button is released.
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt5: The speed of a joystick movement is determined by the distance from the center of the image to the mouse pointer. The greater the distance, the greater the speed.
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt6: Center or joystick mode is selected from the PTZ Control Panel (see below), or by clicking the button in the AMC viewer toolbar (see above).
liveview_h.abs_relative_Txt6-1: Center or joystick mode is selected from the PTZ Control Panel, or by clicking the button in the AMC viewer toolbar.
liveview_h.wheel_zoom_Txt1: Wheel zoom - it is also possible to use the mouse wheel to zoom the view in and out.
liveview_h.wheel_zoom_Txt2: Note: Pan and tilt must be enabled under PTZ > Controls.
liveview_h.area_zoom_Txt: Area zoom - allows you to zoom into a desired area in the image. Click the button to activate Center mode. Using your mouse, click in the image and while holding down the left mouse button, draw a square over the area to zoom into.
liveview_h.calibrate_Txt: Note that the area zoom function may need to be configured before use. This is done from Setup > PTZ Configuration > Advanced > Calibration.
liveview_h.focus_iris_Txt: The Focus can be adjusted manually by using the control bar, or set for automatic adjustment, by clicking the Auto Focus button (found on the PTZ Control Panel, see below).
liveview_h.panel_Txt: Various other controls are also available from the web interface. Note that some controls are only found on the PTZ Control Panel, which is opened by clicking the Ctrl panel button. Settings made in the PTZ control panel only affect the current state of the camera, not the camera's default configuration made in Camera Settings.
liveview_h.areaZoom_Txt: Area Zoom - The area zoom enables magnification (zoom in) to a preferred area of the camera's image. To do this, place the mouse pointer on the part of the image that you want to zoom in, drag to create a rectangle around it and release the mouse. The camera will automatically zoom in to the selected part of the image.
liveview_h.focusWindow_Txt: Focus window - The focus window enables selecting a preferred area of the camera's image that focus should be applied on to get a clearer view. To do this, place the mouse pointer on the part of the image that you want to focus on, drag to create a rectangle around it and release the mouse. The camera will automatically adjust the image focus.
liveview_h.brightnessSlider_Txt: Brightness - This slidebar adjusts the image brightness, where a higher value produces a brighter image. Note that, brightness changes made through this slidebar will not be saved. If you want to save the changes, adjust brightness through Setup > Video > Camera Settings > Brightness.
liveview_h.autofocus_Txt: Control Auto Focus with these buttons. Auto focus is enabled under Video & Audio > Focus & Zoom
liveview_h.bLC_Txt: The Backlight comp on and off buttons control the use of backlight compensation. Enabling this will make the subject clearer if the image background is too bright, or if the subject is too dark.
liveview_h.aIF_Txt: The IR cut filter buttons control the Infrared Cut Filter. When set to off, the camera can 'see' infrared light at night and the image will be clearer. When set to Auto, the camera will automatically switch the IR cut filter on and off, according to changing lighting conditions.
liveview_h.brightness_Txt: Brightness - Control image brightness by clicking + or -. Clicking + produces a brighter image.
liveview_h.iR_lamp_Txt1: The IR lamp mounted in the product can be controlled directly from the Live View page, by the use of the buttons IR Light on and IR Light off.
liveview_h.iR_lamp_Txt3: The IR lamp requires the IR cut filter (IR CF) to be set to Off.
liveview_h.iR_lamp_Txt4: The IR lamp will automatically switch off after 30 minutes.
liveview_h.iRCF_Txt: The IR CF buttons control the Infrared Cut Filter. When set to off, the camera can 'see' infrared light at night and the image will be clearer.
liveview_h.iRCF_auto_Txt: When set to auto, the camera will automatically switch the IR cut filter on and off, according to changing lighting conditions.
liveview_h.iRCF_note1_Txt2: When the IR cut filter is off, the image will be in black & white.
liveview_h.iRCF_auto_note_Txt: Note 2: Setting the IR cut filter to auto is only possible when the iris is set for automatic adjustment (Auto Iris) and when the exposure control is set to automatic.
liveview_h.select_abs_rel_Txt: Navigation Mode - These buttons are used to select either the Center or Joystick mode for click-in-image movement. See the help on PTZ controls above.
liveview_h.ptz_queue_Txt1: The PTZ Control Queue is a system for placing requests for control of the PTZ functions in a queue. The fields show the user's current status and position in the queue and the amount of time remaining until PTZ control is given, or if the user already has control - the amount of control time remaining.
liveview_h.ptz_queue_Txt3: Different user levels have different priorities in the PTZ Control Queue. This means that a viewer can be overridden by an administrator or an operator, and an operator can be overridden by an administrator. Users can be overridden both when in the control queue and when actually 'in control' of the PTZ functions.
liveview_h.ptz_queue_Txt4: Actions that cause the Live View page to reload (e.g. resizing the image) can temporarily cause the queue status to disappear. To rectify this, click the Request Control button again. The user's place in the queue is maintained.
